title: 8 BICLCE - Best Paper Prize
text:
During the 8th Biennial International Conference on the Linguistics of Contemporary English (8 BICLCE) held at the Otto-Friedrich-Universität Bamberg, Germany (26-28 September), I was awarded the prize to the Best Paper presented at the conference by a junior researcher. The paper, entitled Negation and the Cognitive Complexity Principle in the English Clausal Complementation System is part of my PhD project, supervised by Elena Seoane and Manfred Krug.

title: New position at UIB
text: Last September, I obtained a junior lectureship (Ayudante Doctora) at the University of the Balearic Islands. This is a full time tenure-track position for five years.

title: Book published!
text: I just published the volume Probabilistic variability in clausal verb complementation in World Englishes(Peter Lang). The book explores finite and nonfinite clausal verb complementation in World Englishes. It provides an assessment of the influence of language contact, simplicity and transparency, geographical proximity, and evolutionary phase on this alternation. On the one hand, a quantitative analysis of GloWbE data through different statistical tests proves the effects of these factors on the choice between finite that-clauses and nonfinite -ing clauses. A number of intra-linguistic factors are also considered as potential explanatory factors. On the other hand, a detailed, manual, qualitative analysis results in the discovery of a series of new verb complementation structures available in English varieties around the world.

title: Margarita Salas 3-year posdoctoral contract
text: I obtained the three-year postodoctoral contract Margarita Salas, a competitive grant offered by the Ministry of Universities. I will be working with the SPERTUS team, led by Ignacio Palacios Martínez at the University of Santiago de Compostela.

title: Obtain PhD
text:
I obtained my PhD this morning. The dissertation is entitled Variation in the clausal complementation system in World Englishes: A corpus-based study of REGRET and merited the highest grade (sobresaliente cum laude). Supervisors: Elena Seoane (University of Vigo) and Manfred Krug (University of Bamberg).
I want to express our gratitude to the board members, Professors Sarah Buschfeld (TU Dortmund), Pérez-Guerra (Uvigo) and Loureiro-Porto (UIB), for the wealth and depth of their feedback.
I am now a postdoctoral at the University of Vigo.

title: Talk at Pompeu Fabra
text: Last week, I gave an invited talk at the Pompeu Fabra University in Barcelona, with the title Towards Monolingualism: The Linguistic Ecology of Gibraltar. Staff and students drew parallels between the sociolinguistic  situation in Gibraltar and in Catalonia, and were intrigued about the potential creole status of Yanito, one of the vernacular languages. All feedback was exciting and very welcome!

title: Richard M. Hogg Prize
text:
On 2 June I was awarded the Richard M. Hogg Prize of the International Society for the Linguistics of English (IsLE) for my paper Negation as a predictor of clausal complement choice in World Englishes
The Prize is awarded in open competition to early-career scholars, both pre and postdoctoral scholars. The Prize involves cash prize of £500, the publication of her paper on the IsLE website, an invitation and financial support to present her work in the next IsLE conference, and, additionally, an invitation to submit her prize-winning paper for competitive review for publication in English Language and Linguistics, the journal closely associated with the aims of the Society. The paper was later published in this journal in open access.
